posts._title: Cyril Gardner & Edwin H. Knopf – Only Saps Work (1930)
posts.title: Only Saps Work
posts.excerpt: Only Saps Work (a double entendre) is an early sound Paramount light romantic comedy with Leon Errol playing what seems at first an inept crook who tries to rob Richard Arlen. posts._title: Steve Lannin & Matthew Caley – Pop Fiction: The Song in Cinema (2005)
posts.title: Pop Fiction: The Song in Cinema
posts.excerpt: Synopsis: (Amazon.com) The aim of this book is to examine the multifarious placements of the pop song in contemporary cinema through a series of short essays from a variety of perspectives-each looking at the use of ONE pop song in a particular movie. posts.title: Bite the Bullet
posts.excerpt: Description A great mid-1970s cast holds fort in this Western tale of a test of endurance in a 1900s wasteland. A railroad company sponsors a unique competition: a grueling Denver-to-Kansas City horse race that tests the motivation and determination of a motley collection of competitors. posts._title: Roberto Rossellini – India: Matri Bhumi [French version] (1959)
posts.title: India: Matri Bhumi [French version]
posts.excerpt: Quote: India runs counter to all usual cinema: here the image is only the complement of the idea that provokes it. India is a film of absolute logic, more Socratic than Socrates.
